verses.kjv: Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,
verses.web: Therefore leaving the teaching of the first principles of Christ, let’s press on to perfection—not laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works, of faith toward God,
verses.ct: So let's move beyond the basics of what we first learned about Christ and press on toward maturity. We don't need to keep laying the same foundation over and over — repentance from dead works and faith toward God,

verses.kjv: Of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.
verses.web: of the teaching of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.
verses.ct: teaching about baptisms, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.

verses.kjv: And this will we do, if God permit.
verses.web: This will we do, if God permits.
verses.ct: And that's exactly what we'll do, if God permits.

verses.kjv: For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost,
verses.web: For concerning those who were once enlightened and tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Spirit,
verses.ct: Here's why this matters: it's impossible for people who were once enlightened — who tasted the heavenly gift and shared in the Holy Spirit,

verses.kjv: And have tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the world to come,
verses.web: and tasted the good word of God and the powers of the age to come,
verses.ct: who experienced the goodness of God's word and the powers of the age to come —

verses.kjv: If they shall fall away, to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put him to an open shame.
verses.web: and then fell away, it is impossible to renew them again to repentance; seeing they crucify the Son of God for themselves again, and put him to open shame.
verses.ct: and then fell away, to be brought back to repentance again. By turning their backs, they're crucifying the Son of God all over again and holding him up to public disgrace.

verses.kjv: For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God:
verses.web: For the land which has drunk the rain that comes often on it and produces a crop suitable for them for whose sake it is also tilled, receives blessing from God;
verses.ct: Think of it this way: land that soaks up the rain falling on it and produces a useful crop for the farmers who tend it receives God's blessing.

verses.kjv: But that which beareth thorns and briers is rejected, and is nigh unto cursing; whose end is to be burned.
verses.web: but if it bears thorns and thistles, it is rejected and near being cursed, whose end is to be burned.
verses.ct: But land that only grows thorns and thistles is worthless. It's on the verge of being cursed, and in the end it will be burned.

verses.kjv: But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak.
verses.web: But, beloved, we are persuaded of better things for you, and things that accompany salvation, even though we speak like this.
verses.ct: But dear friends, even though we're talking like this, we're confident that better things are in store for you — things that go hand in hand with salvation.

verses.kjv: For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.
verses.web: For God is not unrighteous, so as to forget your work and the labor of love which you showed toward his name, in that you served the saints, and still do serve them.
verses.ct: God is not unjust. He won't forget the work you've done or the love you've shown for his name by serving his people — which you continue to do.

verses.kjv: And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end:
verses.web: We desire that each one of you may show the same diligence to the fullness of hope even to the end,
verses.ct: What we really want is for each of you to show that same dedication all the way to the end, so that your hope will be fully realized.

verses.kjv: That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.web: that you won’t be sluggish, but imitators of those who through faith and perseverance inherited the promises.
verses.ct: Don't become lazy. Instead, follow the example of those who through faith and patience inherited what God promised.

verses.kjv: For when God made promise to Abraham, because he could swear by no greater, he sware by himself,
verses.web: For when God made a promise to Abraham, since he could swear by no one greater, he swore by himself,
verses.ct: When God made his promise to Abraham, there was no one greater he could swear by, so he swore by himself,

verses.kjv: Saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.
verses.web: saying, “Surely blessing I will bless you, and multiplying I will multiply you.”
verses.ct: saying, "I will certainly bless you and give you countless descendants."

verses.kjv: And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
verses.web: Thus, having patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
verses.ct: Abraham waited patiently, and in the end he received what God had promised.

verses.kjv: For men verily swear by the greater: and an oath for confirmation is to them an end of all strife.
verses.web: For men indeed swear by a greater one, and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation.
verses.ct: When people take an oath, they swear by someone greater than themselves, and that oath puts an end to every argument — it settles the matter.

verses.kjv: Wherein God, willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed it by an oath:
verses.web: In this way God, being determined to show more abundantly to the heirs of the promise the immutability of his counsel, interposed with an oath,
verses.ct: God wanted to make it absolutely clear to those who would inherit his promise that his purpose would never change. So he backed it up with an oath.

verses.kjv: That by two immutable things, in which it was impossible for God to lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us:
verses.web: that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we may have a strong encouragement, who have fled for refuge to take hold of the hope set before us.
verses.ct: He did this so that through 2 unchangeable things — his promise and his oath, neither of which God can lie about — we who have run to him for safety would be powerfully encouraged to hold on to the hope placed before us.

verses.kjv: Which hope we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast, and which entereth into that within the veil;
verses.web: This hope we have as an anchor of the soul, a hope both sure and steadfast and entering into that which is within the veil;
verses.ct: This hope is an anchor for our soul, firm and secure. It reaches past the curtain into God's inner sanctuary,

verses.kjv: Whither the forerunner is for us entered, even Jesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
verses.web: where as a forerunner Jesus entered for us, having become a high priest forever after the order of Melchizedek.
verses.ct: where Jesus has already entered on our behalf as a forerunner. He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.
